item.title: Same Pothole has come back at the traffic lights again, 30th July
item.description:
The pothole has come back (again) as it was not filled properly the last time or time before that. The location of this pothole and the traffic light island means motorist can't avoid it, each time it rains this bodged repair sinks lower and lower.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayden Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Post or sign leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees) problem, 30th July
item.description:
Install 2 new 76mm posts and 2000mm x 800mm chevron sign. Plus 2000mm x 800mm chevron sign to existing posts.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Post or sign leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees)

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 30th July
item.description:
Customer reports a cluster of potholes, around 1 metre in spread and in areas greater than tennis ball in depth at the location. Potholes in the location have caused multiple punctures to their vehicle.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pubic access blocked, 30th July
item.description:
Following the reported of vegetation and hedges blocking the footpath in four places from the road bridge works on the London road up to Hearne road and no action from your selves the residents have now signed a letter which has now been sent to our MP resulting in school children, disable and the elderly having to use the main London road to by pass the obstructions
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 332, London Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects -CW6 Potholes problem, 30th July
